# Tailwind CSS Skill

> Utility-first CSS framework for {{category}} projects

## When to Use

Use this skill for styling components with utility classes, responsive design, and theming.

## Key Concepts

| Concept | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| Utilities | Single-purpose classes | `p-4`, `text-lg`, `flex` |
| Responsive | Mobile-first breakpoints | `md:flex`, `lg:grid` |
| States | Hover, focus, etc. | `hover:bg-blue-500` |
| Dark Mode | Theme switching | `dark:bg-gray-900` |

## Patterns for {{category}}

```tsx
// Responsive card component
function Card({ title, children }) {
  return (
    <div className="
      rounded-lg border bg-white p-4 shadow-sm
      dark:bg-gray-800 dark:border-gray-700
      hover:shadow-md transition-shadow
    ">
      <h3 className="text-lg font-semibold text-gray-900 dark:text-white">
        {title}
      </h3>
      <div className="mt-2 text-gray-600 dark:text-gray-300">
        {children}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

// Common patterns
const patterns = {
  // Centering
  center: 'flex items-center justify-center',
  // Container
  container: 'mx-auto max-w-7xl px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8',
  // Button
  button: 'rounded-md bg-blue-600 px-4 py-2 text-white hover:bg-blue-700',
  // Input
  input: 'rounded-md border border-gray-300 px-3 py-2 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2',
};
```

## Breakpoints

| Prefix | Min Width |
|--------|-----------|
| sm | 640px |
| md | 768px |
| lg | 1024px |
| xl | 1280px |
| 2xl | 1536px |

## Pitfalls

- Don't mix Tailwind with custom CSS unnecessarily
- Use `@apply` sparingly (prefer component extraction)
- Remember mobile-first (base styles apply to all)
- Purge unused styles in production
